The Sunoco Pipeline, L.P. (Sunoco) Hopedale Station located in Jewett, Ohio receives product from the nearby MarkWest Facility and serves as a storage facility for the Mariner East II Pipeline (MEII). The Hopedale Station receives propane and butane from the MarkWest Facility via two dedicated 16 inch pipelines, stores the product in two pressurized spheres, and discharges into the 20 inch Rose Valley Road pipeline.



Two requirements of this section specifically apply to operations at the Hopedale Station:



1.  Purpose and General Duty Clause - The essence of the general duty clause is that an owner/operator that stores and uses hazardous chemicals in any quantity has a fundamental obligation to ensure a safe operation and to have plans in place in the event of an accident to appropriately manage the situation. Sunoco is committed to ensuring the safe operation of the Hopedale Station, as well as all of its other operations, to ensure a safe workplace for our employees and a safe location for our neighbors in the community. Sunoco, therefore, has procedures in place to prevent accidents and is committed to emergency preparedness both for our facility and community-wide by coordinating with the Jewett Volunteer Fire Department and the Harrison County Emergency Management Agency.



2.  Risk Management Plan - The primary function of the Hopedale Station is to act as a LP-gas storage facility.  Due to the flammable effects associated with propane and butane, it is necessary to observe certain safety precautions to prevent unnecessary human exposure, to reduce the threat to employee health, and to minimize the threat and impact to nearby members of the community.  Sunoco Pipeline's Hopedale Station is strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety and health.
